availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Marshall County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married to Atlanta G. Dycus. Father of Francesca Dycus, John W. Dycus, Ellah C. Dycus, Analiza Dycus, Emmit C. Dycus, Emma G. Dycus, and Mary A. Dycus. Physician in Montgomery County, Tennessee, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Physician in Marshall County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Montgomery County, p. 231A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Tennessee, Montgomery County.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, p. 119.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, Birmingham District, p. 31.
Find A Grave, "Dr Elijah Carroll Dycus (1820-1906)," Memorial #7392730, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/7392730# (accessed August 21, 2018).
